channel.title: Posts on Rui's Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Rui's Site

item.title: Subarray Sum I
item.description:
Given an integer array, find a subarray where the sum of numbers is zero. Your code should return the index of the first number and the index of the last number.

    
public class Solution {
    /**
     * @param nums: A list of integers
     * @return: A list of integers includes the index of the first number 
     *          and the index of the last number
     */
    public ArrayList subarraySum(int[] nums) {
        // write your code here
        ArrayList res = new ArrayList();
        if(nums == null || nums.length == 0)
            return res;       
        HashMap map = new HashMap();
        int sum = 0;
        map.put(0, 0);
        for(int i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
            if(map.containsKey(sum+nums[i])) {
                res.add(map.get(sum+nums[i]));
                res.add(i);
                return res;
            }
            map.put(sum+=nums[i], i+1);
        }
        return res;
    }
}

item.title: Subarray Sum II
item.description:
Given an integer array, find a subarray where the sum of numbers is between two given interval. Your code should return the number of possible answer.


public int subarraySumII(int[] A, int start, int end) {
    int res = 0;
        for(int i = 1; i < A.length; i++)
            A[i] += A[i - 1];
        
        Arrays.sort(A);
        for(int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
            if(A[i] >= start && A[i] <= end)
                res++;
            // start <= A[i] - A[j] <= end
            // so the max bound and min bound of A[j] are following:
            int max = A[i] - start;
            int min = A[i] - end;
            // max + 1 make sure the right bound of max value and also index problem
            int range = findInsPos(A, max + 1) - findInsPos(A, min);
            res += range;
        }
        return res;
}
private int findInsPos(int[] A, int value) {
        int l = 0, r = A.length - 1;
        
        while(l < r - 1) {
            int m = l + ((r - l) >>1);
            if(A[m] < value)
                l = m;
            else
                r = m;
        }
        if(A[l] >= value)
            return l;
        else
            return r;
}

item.title: Algorithm Questions Conclusion
item.description:
Preface:

This is the collection of interview questions concluded by me, which is including questions from LeetCode, Cracking Code Interview, and Handwriting Coding Handbook.
